lender.name: Cathy
lender.loan_because: I believe that what is to me, a relatively small amount of money, can influence and improve the quality of life for someone else -- and these loans are able to give the borrowers control over the money and its use.
lender.occupational_info: My husband and I are partners in a company which provides on-site computer hardware and software support.

lender.name: Demi
lender.loan_because: this is the best way to empower women, giving them the opportunity not to depend anymore from the men of the family and thus be seen as worthy, important and "useful". Also, giving the chance to create a small business means an occupation potentially for the future generations of the family.

lender.name: Financially Savvy
lender.loan_because:
The drive and commitment demonstrated by these entrepreneurs inspires me. Their tenacity and creativity remind me of my favorite quote from Mary Kay Ash...
"Don't limit yourself. Many people limit themselves to what they think they can do. You can go as far as your mind lets you. What you believe, remember, you can achieve."
I loan so wonderful people around the world can achieve their dreams.
lender.occupational_info: Money should empower, not intimidate. I believe that anyone, once taught, can successfully manage his/her own finances. I have dedicated myself to educating people about prudent money management in non-threatening and unbiased environment.

lender.name: Maureen
lender.loan_because: Opportunities have been presented to me along the way and I would like to offer a helping hand to others.

lender.name: Lydia
lender.loan_because: I like that I can help others develop and grow their businesses. It's nice to 'give back' in a manner that encourages self sufficiency and rewards initiative and hard work.

lender.name: Southern Maryland Woman
lender.loan_because: Whether you are a small business owner in Washington, DC, or the owner of a village grocery store in Latin America or Africa, entrepeneurs face the same challenges no matter where they live, or what goods/services they provide. As a fellow entrepeneur we understand that money is simply a necessary tool every business needs to grow. If one compares business to farming where one begins by preparing the soil, planting the seeds etc., money is the fertilizer. Entrepeneurs are by nature committed, courageous, and creative, and help others in the process of operating their own businesses. Assisting other individuals to become self sufficient is much more meaningful than simply giving money which creates dependence rather than freedom.
lender.occupational_info: As publishers of "THE SOUTHERN MARYLAND WOMAN", we recognize the important responsibility we have to our readers and the entire community. We provide empowering information, education and resources to women to help them make the best and most informed decisions for themselves and those they love. We publish informative, objective, and educational articles written by local professionals and business owners on a variety of topics of interest to women of all ages, backgrounds, and ethnicity. Lastly we are committed to supporting non-profit and charitable organizations who share our mission - Improving the lives of women and their families through education.

lender.name: Gillian

lender.occupational_info: I work to build and maintain relationships between, young people, community organizations, and government agencies.

lender.occupational_info: My family owns a business where we rent bicycles to local people or visitors on vacation who want to get around town without a car.

lender.name: Teri
lender.loan_because:
"Why?"
On the street I saw a small girl, cold and shivering in a thin dress, with little hope of a decent meal. I became angry and said to God, "Why did you permit this? Why don't you do something about it?"
For a while God said nothing.
That night He replied quite suddenly, "I certainly did something about it. I made you."
~~ Author Unknown
lender.occupational_info: My goal is to fund 1 Kiva loan a month for a year. In addition to that, all repayments will be turned back into new loans. I'm excited to see what my investment of $300 will do over the years!

lender.name: Martha & Gerry
lender.loan_because: "You know, there's a lot of talk in this country about the federal deficit. But I think we should talk more about our empathy deficit -- the ability to put ourselves in someone else's shoes; to see the world through the eyes of those who are different from us -- the child who's hungry, the steelworker who's been laid-off, the family who lost the entire life they built together when the storm came to town. When you think like this -- when you choose to broaden your ambit of concern and empathize with the plight of others, whether they are close friends or distant strangers -- it becomes harder not to act; harder not to help." -- Barack Obama

lender.name: Isaac
lender.loan_because: I would like to make a change in the lives of others.
lender.occupational_info:
BEACON OF HOPE UGANDA Registration No. MKN/CBO 082/2008
Concept Paper/Proposal for: Income Generation Initiatives: Candle Making Mukono, Uganda
Friday September 26th 2008 Isaac Ssamba Chairman, Beacon of Hope Uganda, tel. +256753216892 / beaconyouths@yahoo.com
1. Project Summary
Project Title - Income Generating Initiatives: Candle Making Budget: US $ 1304 Submitted - Friday September 26th 2008 Organization - Beacon of Hope Uganda Chairman: Isaac Ssamba Tel: +256753216892 beaconyouths@yahoo.com
2. Problem Statement/Justification
Without careful planning and implementation of income generating initiatives the likelihood for Mukono to become a slum is possible. The population density in Mukono is 175.7 people per km², 29.5% higher than the national average and the rate of urbanization in Mukono is 25.3 compared the national average of 12.27. Many of the youths age 14-19 are out of school and unable to afford school fees. The local streets witness a flood of youths whom scrape by for a means to live. Some youths often resort to illegal activities like joining gangs in order to retain a small income for food. Beacon of Hope looks to provide these youths with the opportunity to earn some money part time and teach them to utilize these funds for education either in academics or vocational training. This will help alleviate them from poverty, empower their minds and boost their self confidence to help them to create positives futures for themselves.
3. Project Description
This income generating initiative will look to empower youths with the opportunity to work part time with our organization in the particular activity of candle making. The project will look towards targeting youths whom are unable to afford school fees or life’s basic necessities. The expected results look to achieve a higher ratio of youths between the ages of 14-19 capable to afford food, school fees or further vocational training. These youths, the primary beneficiaries, would be reaping the profits of a encouraging project focused principally on their lives. Instead of looking on the street for work the primary beneficiaries, will be given the opportunity to work with members of the community and Beacon of Hope Uganda in order to establish a small income. The beneficiaries will have the opportunity to get off the streets and establish themselves as trained candle makers. This project will also look to encourage youths to save and utilize their resources to go and learn other trade works either through apprenticeships or vocational schools. The beneficiaries involved with this project will learn important marketing skills and will become well educated on the benefits of learning market networks. This will increase their resources and means to make a living as they learn other skills throughout their lives. By showing these youths a productive, effective and honest way to earn a small income it will boost their self confidence and make them eager to learn how to create an advantageous future for themselves
4. Organizational Experience/Capacity
Although our organization is young (2006), the exuberance and potential within Beacon of Hope is elevated by the individuals whom comprise the organization. Well educated and informed the members look to empower youths and enable them with the opportunities to exceed and experience a lively and optimistic life experience. The members of Beacon of Hope have had past experiences as candle makers and are able and willing to pass that experience down to the youths in Mukono. Our headquarters will be used as the training and construction center for this activity and our candle making professionals will be present teaching the youths during several training seminars. Since 2006 Beacon of Hope has generated many genuine relationships with community members around Mukono. We will use this network and look to expand it when the time comes to initiate the selling phase of this program.
5. Coordination
Beacon of Hope has recently held several community meetings throughout Mukono and has received positive feedback concerning such IGI’s like candle making. Many community members are willing to help and participate with youths in aiding them to learn how to make superb candles to be sold on the market or teach the youth’s ways to access the markets and make valuable market networks. We also look to collaborate with local ministries and governments in order to help establish the project in terms of funding and possibly create more programs like this that would benefit the over abundance of disadvantaged youths in Mukono.
6. Strength and Innovation
We look to initiate multiple innovative and unique programs to help empower the distressed youths in Mukono. Our expertise and well designed initiatives will be sustainable for the beneficiaries and provide them with a small income at which they could use for school fees or other important life necessities. Beacon of Hope Uganda has chosen candle making because of the need for them. Not only are they effective during power shortages but they will also be a good instrument to repel mosquitoes as each candle will have mosquito repellant added into its mixture of dye and wax. The members of Beacon of Hope have already been trained as candle makers and are looking to pass on the knowledge and expertise to youths throughout Mukono. Sectors of the market we look to target will be churches as well as private schools that can afford to buy candles for their dormitories. The students will also be encouraged to find their own avenue in the local market with guidance from Beacon of Hope and members from the community.
7. Budget
Raw Materials Quantity Cost Wax – refined 200 kg US $ 447 Candle Wick 8kg roll US $ 180 Satiric acid powder 10kg US $ 37 2 mould machines 50 pieces US $ 387 Colors oil Soluble 2kg US $ 80 Mosquito repellants 1500mls US $ 34 Administrative (%) 5% of project cost US $ 59 Totals US $ 1304
Level of Objectives Objectively Verifiable Indicators – Indicators and targets Means of Verification (Data sources) Assumptions and Risks Impact: Youth empowerment, education and trade knowledge increases and poverty eradication decreases. 1. 70% improved levels of well being. 2. 70% of beneficiaries report higher self esteem after leaving program to work elsewhere. 1. Surveys. 2. Questionnaires. 3. Organizational report. 4. Interviews with beneficiaries. 1. Beneficiaries encourage other disadvantaged youths in the community to partake in similar programs. Outcomes 1. Increased income generation and improved livelihoods among youths in Mukono. 2. Less youths on the street, less crime. 3. Youths self esteem rises, eager to learn more. 1. 70% increase in beneficiaries reporting better living standards. 2. 70% of beneficiaries utilizing new trade skills to earn income. 3. 70% of beneficiaries report higher levels of self confidence when learning a new trade. 1. Surveys. 2. Questionnaires. 3. Organizational report. 4. Interviews with beneficiaries. Assumptions: 1. Youths trade skills and knowledge welcomed on the market. 2. Youths utilize income to pay for education or more vocational training. Risks: 1. Unpredictable markets. Outputs 1. Youths participating and learning trade. 2. Candles are produced and market ready. 3. Increased community involvement with youths. 1. 100% of youths participating are initiating the candle making process. 2. 70% of the youths have successfully made quality candles ready for the market. 3. 60% youths are interacting with the community, establishing networks for their candles. 1. Organizational reports. 2. Interviews with beneficiaries. Assumptions: 1. Beneficiaries successfully apply knowledge and skills gained in workshops. 2. Tendency for beneficiaries to turn to trade work instead of crime. Risks: 1. Youths may use income for the purchase of illegal substances. 2. Youths could be targeted and robbed. Activities 1.Buy Materials to make candles 2. Candle Workshops 3.Candle Making 4. Selling candles 1. Budget = 1,869,000 2. Buy raw materials for market friendly items. 3. Setup candle workshops for youths. 4. Setup Market network to distribute product. 1. Organizational reports.
Assumptions: 1. Youths are willing to participate. 2. Funding is provided to establish the program. 3. Community members willing to participate and help teach youths. Risks: Materials could be stolen.

lender.name: Kylie
lender.loan_because: I want to do something to make a difference in the lives of people.

lender.name: Nancy Nyasha
lender.loan_because: I loan because i need the start-up cost to buy software and material required to create personalised books for young children. The start up cost will also enable me to join the Create-a-Book World wide program and become one of their dearlers. I strongly believe in this business and have a passion for books and reading. It is my dream to spread and instill the culture of reading in every young Zimbabwean. Therefore this loan will enable me to start off my dream bussiness.
lender.occupational_info:
The Create-a-Book bussiness has an impact on both young and old, for the books not only intertain but educate young children. The stories teach young readers sharing and moral values. The books motivate young children to read as they are the main characters or heros of their own stories. Above all the books will encourage young people in Zimbabwe to adopt the culture of readin. This bussiness has a positive impact on youth who are tommorrow's leaders. Create-a-Book's slogan "Today's Readers- Tommorrows Leaders" will be the driving force of my bussiness.
The books are personalised storybooks that weaves deatails into any one of a variety of tittles, making the child the star of their own story. The books feature, the child's name,age, three freinds' names and hometown throughout the story. The books are treasured as keep sakes for the rest of the recipient's life. This bussiness will therefore, not only encourage reading in Zimbabwe and Africa in turn. It will also create a new and empowered generation of readers

lender.loan_because: I want to help the world be a better place.

lender.name: Robert M
lender.loan_because:
I have personal experience with "hard work" and "struggle", with "hopes" and "dreams" -- and considerable familiarity with the frustration of "I could, if only ..."
I don't have much, but certainly enough to satisfy my needs ... and which, in itself, is a great deal "more" than the vast majority of humanity can claim.
I count my blessings daily. And I seek to share my blessings, in my own modest and humble way, with those seeking a solution to "I could, if only..."
This is why I lend through KIVA.
lender.occupational_info:
Boring and physical. On the other hand, I have considerable "independence" in what I do and how I do it - which I happen to do very well. I am able to simultaneously satisfy own (high) work standards, accomplish my employer's mission, demonstrate to and encourage true "teamwork" amongst my fellow co-workers, and provide a useful/helpful "service" to others (our customers).
Though my occupation may be "lowly", it does provide a number of "rewards" that I find personally gratifying - not the least of which is consistently "exceeding the expectations" of both my employer and (especially) my customers.

lender.name: marcia

lender.name: Heather

lender.name: Katharine

lender.occupational_info: Heading back to school soon to pursue a career in medicine!

lender.name: Chris Lee

Im very blessed to have a good career, family, home, and country. I understand not everyone is as fortunate, so I try and help where I can.

lender.name: Margaret
lender.loan_because: I want to help others to help themselves.
lender.occupational_info: I look after the thousands of books in my school library, lending them to students and teachers.

lender.name: Rebecca

In other parts of the world, that's not true for various reasons. I hope that by lending to someone, I can help them gain the kind of freedom that I enjoy.
lender.occupational_info: I'm an accountant, and from Alabama. That's pretty much it.

lender.name: Tabia
lender.loan_because: I'm lucky enough to be able to )))

lender.name: Robin

lender.occupational_info: I work in Foreign Affairs, so in my work there is a lot of space to reflect upon how every culture and people interrelate. We are many people, one humanity.

lender.occupational_info: I work and go to school. My work consists of roasting, and selling coffee.

lender.name: Teresa
lender.loan_because: I can.
lender.occupational_info: I'm still a student enjoying my journey, education and exploration in the world.

lender.name: Denise
lender.loan_because: As an Aussie living in the USA, I know I am very fortunate as I have travelled the world and seen many different cultures.... we as human beings have a few things in common.... to love & care for others and to want a better life for themselves and their loved ones.... I hope I can help others fulfil their goals!

lender.name: Rose

lender.occupational_info: I am an entrepreneur providing professional administrative office assistance to my clients from transcription to call backs, everything in between and more.

lender.name: Jill (jali)
lender.loan_because: We're supposed to help each other

lender.name: Donna

lender.occupational_info: I am a teacher. My students are between 5 to 11 years old.

lender.name: Lisa
lender.loan_because: It makes me feel grateful for what I have and reminds me how there are so many others that are less fortunate. I am also doing this because my I am so inspired by my daughter Teresa and all she has done to make this world a better place.
lender.occupational_info: I do kitchen and bath remodeling sales

lender.name: Skyler
lender.loan_because: I want to do some little good in the world. I want to help women.

lender.name: Susan
lender.loan_because: I want to help someone become successful at their dreams.
lender.occupational_info: I help people with marketing and acquisition of homes. I love what do which has made me successful.

lender.name: Sara
lender.loan_because: I never would have thought I could make a difference so easily.
lender.occupational_info: I make commercials for cartoons on TV.

lender.name: holgerhbaer
lender.loan_because: I loan because I have been given so many opportunities by people around me. With Kiva, I hope I can help giving opportunity to people that haven't been so fortunate as to be born in an affluent place in this world. People around the globe deserve a bit more solidarity
lender.occupational_info: working at an institute that does research in environmental politics and sustainability strategies

lender.name: Burkhard
lender.loan_because: When I try to explain to people at parties what I do for a living (legal philosopher) their eyes tend to glaze over immediately. Thanks to Kiva, now I can simply claim to be a venture capitalist with a highly diversified global investment portfolio.
lender.occupational_info: I try to understand and improve the way science is used in legal settings

lender.name: Alberto

lender.name: MS. DOROTHY
lender.loan_because: I loan because I know and understand what it is like to not have enough money to meet your basic obligations. I give because it is a joy to be able to give to others; and because God's Word says; Give and it shall be given unto you.. Lk. 6:38.

lender.name: Barrie Medical Clinic
lender.loan_because: we are doctors, and care about the health of our patients - but we also care about the health of the world.
lender.occupational_info: We are a group of family physicians who work together to provide after-hours care to our patients in Barrie, Ontario.

lender.name: LORINDA
lender.loan_because: The amazing results that can come of it. Hard working people who just need a helping hand to assist them to being successful in their lives.

lender.name: Kim and Dan

lender.name: Jennifer
lender.loan_because: little things beget bigger things
lender.occupational_info: I read and write a great deal

lender.name: Patti J.
lender.loan_because: "To those much is given, much is expected."

lender.name: Ed.
lender.loan_because: I want to make a difference in the lives of others. Giving them an opportunity to pursue their dreams regardless of economic, political, or regional limitations.
lender.occupational_info: QA Analyst for a large pharmaceutical contract manufacturer. I work daily to ensure regulatory compliance, safety, and integrity of products delivered to patients worldwide.

lender.occupational_info: I am currently studying Electrical Engineering with a specialization in Energy & Environment, and will be working for a utility company in Alberta when I graduate.

lender.name: Ivory
lender.loan_because: It is hard to get by and make a decent living and I have a great respect for people that are trying. I enjoy the feeling of altruism and I want to share what God has given to me.
lender.occupational_info: I am in the Social Service field. I Manage an office and write the goals for an agency that supports families with disabled dependents.

lender.name: Jill
lender.loan_because: Someone was there for me when I needed to get started. Now it is my turn to pay it forward and help another mother step forward and provide for herself, her family, and her children.
lender.occupational_info: I am a mother. I love my family. I work with Deaf children. I use to be a teacher before I became a mother. Now I work in our community and our church with Deaf children and elderly Deaf people. Sometimes I interpret in American Sign Language sometimes I teach reading and math to Deaf children. My whole family if fluent in sign language.

lender.name: Erin
lender.loan_because:
I can.
I am selfish: I want to live in a generous world.
lender.occupational_info: I work to ensure the security of people and their property, protecting their homes and businesses.

lender.name: Wally & Monique
lender.loan_because: What goes around, comes around, and it's just the right thing to do.

lender.name: Mari-lize
lender.occupational_info: I had a great job at as a personal assistant and secretary. But I was diagnosed with breast cancer at the age of 26, and as a result lost my job. At present, I am 28 years old and I am cancer-free for two years. But now I can’t find a decent job. I see myself as a serious artist, and I love to be creative. I sell my artworks at local galleries, and to friends and family members. I also create business cards for various business owners, and I just started exploring web design. My hope is to start my own gallery/gift/coffee shop someday.

lender.name: Paul
lender.loan_because: I enjoy helping people less fortunate than myself, as I believe everyone who is willing to pursue their dreams and is prepared to take the chance deserves some support,

lender.name: Kurt
lender.loan_because: I want to help

lender.name: Per

lender.name: Fredrik
lender.loan_because:
I can - 240 million families are living on less than 1 USD a day
Standard-issue charities can take as much as 40 cents of 1$ for administrative costs, Kiva directs 100% to borrowers Just do it!
Reaching the poorest and ensuring a positive, measurable impact on the lives of poor people and their families around the world. Spread Kiva love!
lender.occupational_info: 2 kids, 6 and 8 years old. Living in the outskirts of the capital, in Norway.
